homes_hear_details: Indiana's HOMES and HEAR programs are pending launch. The Indiana Office of Energy Development is working on program design and implementation using approximately $84 million in IRA funding allocated to Indiana.

income_thresholds.low_income_80_ami: For a family of four in Indianapolis, 80% AMI is approximately $60,100. Low-income households will qualify for the highest rebate levels under HOMES when the program launches.
income_thresholds.moderate_income_150_ami: For a family of four in Indianapolis, 150% AMI is approximately $112,700. Moderate-income households will qualify for partial rebates under HOMES when the program launches.

net_metering: Indiana's net metering policy was phased down under SEA 309 (2017). Customers who installed solar before July 2022 retain full retail-rate net metering for 30 years. New installations receive a gradually declining excess distributed generation (EDG) credit rate, trending toward the utility's avoided cost rate by 2032.

state_tax_credits.name: Indiana does not currently offer state-level tax credits for residential clean energy
state_tax_credits.details: Indiana does not have a state renewable energy tax credit or energy efficiency tax credit. Residents can still claim the federal 30% Investment Tax Credit for solar PV and battery storage. Indiana has a property tax exemption for renewable energy systems.

state_rebate_programs.name: Indiana Weatherization Assistance Program
state_rebate_programs.administrator: Indiana Housing and Community Development Authority (IHCDA)
state_rebate_programs.eligible_items: Insulation, air sealing, furnace repair or replacement, water heater replacement, window and door repair
state_rebate_programs.details: Available to households at or below 200% of the federal poverty level. Priority given to elderly, disabled, and families with young children.

state_rebate_programs.name: Energizing Indiana (Successor Programs)
state_rebate_programs.eligible_items: Energy efficiency upgrades including HVAC, insulation, and appliances through individual utility programs
state_rebate_programs.details: Following the end of the statewide Energizing Indiana program, individual utilities now administer their own demand-side management programs under Indiana Utility Regulatory Commission oversight.

programs.name: Duke Energy Home Energy Efficiency Programs
programs.eligible_items: Smart thermostats, HVAC tune-ups, heat pumps, insulation, air sealing

programs.name: Duke Energy Residential Smart Saver Program
programs.eligible_items: ENERGY STAR heat pumps, central air conditioners, heat pump water heaters

programs.name: AEP Indiana Michigan Power Rebates
programs.eligible_items: Smart thermostats, efficient HVAC, LED lighting, ENERGY STAR appliances

programs.name: CenterPoint Energy Efficiency Rebates
programs.eligible_items: High-efficiency furnaces, heat pumps, insulation, smart thermostats, water heaters
